snippet.textDisplay:
Agreed! Its not bhakti atmosphere for me too.. others may differ.. 

To me, its an attempted (con)fusion of totally 
unrelated genres (Carnatic+Sufi+Rock), 
unrelated languages (Sanskrit+Punjabi), 
unrelated Lyrics (strong Devi chant+devotional poetry)

I know Fusion music is all about creating magic in finding harmony in mixing two or more different styles.. but some compositions are not meant for that.. because its not only about tempo, it has to gel, keep the spirit of the composition alive!
snippet.textOriginal:
Agreed! Its not bhakti atmosphere for me too.. others may differ..

unrelated Lyrics (strong Devi chant+devotional poetry)

I know Fusion music is all about creating magic in finding harmony in mixing two or more different styles.. but some compositions are not meant for that.. because its not only about tempo, it has to gel, keep the spirit of the composition alive!

snippet.textDisplay: The song is so nicely fused.. Agreed that not a lot of people like this kind of music but that's your personal opinion and it doesn't and will not make an amazing song 'Satanic". I would love the people simply calling it satanic to let all of us know how much do they know about the term and on what basis have they evaluated this piece of art as "Satanic". Also, please go ahead and research the word "Fusion". I mean what did you expect? "Badtameez Dil"??

snippet.textDisplay: Those throwing their unsolicited opinions at this song must realize that the world is much bigger and much more inclusive than their minds. The discordant music actually plays well into the subject of the song (mahishasura mardhini, the destroyer), and I thought it was pretty intelligently fused. Everyone expresses their devotion in their own ways, and why not let this be another expression of devotion?
snippet.textOriginal: Those throwing their unsolicited opinions at this song must realize that the world is much bigger and much more inclusive than their minds. The discordant music actually plays well into the subject of the song (mahishasura mardhini, the destroyer), and I thought it was pretty intelligently fused. Everyone expresses their devotion in their own ways, and why not let this be another expression of devotion?

snippet.textDisplay: For me, it is more spiritual than religious. I must say that fusing something like 'Aigiri Nandini' with 'Thaiya Thaiya' was not the best of the combinations... It was like being served with tea after you have had amazing chocolate ice-cream. Both of these songs operate at very different spiritual energy levels.... both of the songs are great in their own rights but I felt like I climbed up to a high hill and then suddenly fell down a steep cliff.
snippet.textOriginal: For me, it is more spiritual than religious. I must say that fusing something like 'Aigiri Nandini' with 'Thaiya Thaiya' was not the best of the combinations... It was like being served with tea after you have had amazing chocolate ice-cream. Both of these songs operate at very different spiritual energy levels.... both of the songs are great in their own rights but I felt like I climbed up to a high hill and then suddenly fell down a steep cliff.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi Alejendro! Good to hear that you have liked it. 
Its actually a 'stotram' (some special set of Sanskrit chants), like a poem, that sings the different forms of the Goddess, Her names, Her powerful deeds to vanquish the demonic entity called Mahishasura and similar evil powers! However, in this piece only the first paragraph of the chant is sung 'Aigiri Nandini....'.! 
I am sending you a link where you will find the full stotram and its english meanings! Hope you will enjoy it!
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi Alejendro! Good to hear that you have liked it. 
Its actually a 'stotram' (some special set of Sanskrit chants), like a poem, that sings the different forms of the Goddess, Her names, Her powerful deeds to vanquish the demonic entity called Mahishasura and similar evil powers! However, in this piece only the first paragraph of the chant is sung 'Aigiri Nandini....'.! 
I am sending you a link where you will find the full stotram and its english meanings! Hope you will enjoy it!
